articles.content: Borris-in-Ossory Kilcotton GAA club is giving you the chance to win a valuable prize in a draw to support the club which plays a big part in the community. The club is busy selling tickets for the raffle to win a grade U Belgian Blue cross heifer bor... [634 chars]

articles.title: CAAP, CIAC, PhilSCA ink deal to establish Clark Aviation Campus
articles.description: The Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines (CAAP), Clark International Airport Corporation (CIAC), and the Philippine State College of Aeronautics (PhilSCA) have signed an agreement for the development of the Clark Aviation Campus.
articles.content:

articles.title: Follow World Test Championship cricket scores, results, start time and minute-by-minute news updates
articles.description: Following decades of falling agonisingly short of success, South Africa is on the cusp of a first major cricket triumph with 69 runs needed to win the world Test championship on day four at Lord’s on Saturday. Don’t miss a moment of the action.
articles.content:
Steve Smith faces a race to be fit in time for the West Indies tour after his badly dislocated finger was put back in place and then stitched up in hospital overnight.

articles.title: Air India Plane crash: Pilot's last message was Mayday, flight started sinking after reaching 650 ft - Aviation Ministry
articles.description: The aviation ministry on Saturday said that the flight data recorder of the Air India plane that crashed in Ahmedabad on Saturday has been found, adding that the flight had climbed 650 feet in the air before it started descending.
articles.content:
The aviation ministry on Saturday said that the last message of the pilot of the Air India plane that crashed in Ahmedabad on Saturday was ‘Mayday’, adding that the flight had climbed 650 feet in the air before it started descending.

articles.title: Chinese astronomers recorded details of dying star’s explosion in 1408: study
articles.description: Modern researchers think they have identified the stellar remnant and are appealing to observatories to take a closer look
articles.content:
Just after sunset on an October evening in 1408, six years into the reign of the Ming dynasty’s Emperor Yongle, Chinese court astronomers spotted a mysterious new star glowing high in the southern sky, near the heart of the Milky Way.

articles.title: Sean Connery turned down 'disgusting' role which won actor an Oscar
articles.description: Legendary actor and Academy Awards winner Sean Connery turned down a film which won its star an Oscar as the James Bond actor called it a 'disgusting' role.
articles.content:
Sean Connery turned down a movie role which could have bagged him an Oscar as it was 'disgusting'
